outputs.output_descr: The Environment and Natural Disaster Management Programme supports the government's efforts towards enhancing institutional and community capacities for the management of natural resources and addressing land tenure, climate change adaptation and mitigation, natural disaster, and environmental governance. Recognising the acute environmental challenges the country is faced with through natural incidents; UNDP will also build on the existing capacity and ongoing programmes to address issues of biodiversity, land management, renewable energy and conservation.  It will ensure that environmental management is integrated into general planning processes and more specifically into the Poverty Reduction Strategy policy.  The programme will also be looking at promoting the link between natural resource, climate change and disaster management since these are sources that threaten long-term development actions of the Government of Sierra Leone.

project_descr: Preventive Development Support on Disaster Risk Management
